page.title: 13A BARN DANCE AT RADLEY GREEN
page.content: The annual Barn Dance to raise funds for St.Paul's church Highwood was held on Saturday 22nd June 1985 in a barn at Colley Bridge Farm,{RADLEY GREEN.} The barn was cleared and decorated with coloured lights.It was a cold,wet windy evening but this didn't spoil the fun for the 100 people who atten- ded.A caller shouted the instructions for the dances,music was from records. We often went wrong but this made it seem funnier.Everyone joined in some dances if only to keep warm.We danced the Gay Gordons,Strip the Willow,St. Bernard Waltz and many others. A supper of cheese,pickle,cold sausage and salad was served half way through the evening.The landlord of the Green Man pub ran a mobile bar. A raffle with lots of prizes raised over Â£50.The Barn Dance ended at Mid- night and we all had a very good time.
